intro: Distictella cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf distictella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Distictella cuneifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
